text: Botswana is expected to compete at the 2020 Summer Olympics in Tokyo. Originally scheduled to take place from 24 July to 9 August 2020, the Games have been postponed to 23 July to 8 August 2021, because of the COVID-19 pandemic. It will be the nation's eleventh consecutive appearance at the Summer Olympics. ==Athletics== Botswana athletes achieved the entry standards, either by qualifying time or by world ranking, in the following track and field events (up to a maximum of 3 athletes in each event): ;Track & road events {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !colspan="2"|Heat !colspan="2"|Semifinal !colspan="2"|Final |-style="font-size:95%" !Result !Rank !Result !Rank !Result !Rank |-align=center |align=left|Nijel Amos |align=left|Men's 800 m | | | | | | |-align=center |align=left|Christine Botlogetswe |align=left rowspan=2|Women's 400 m | | | | | | |-align=center |align=left|Galefele Moroko | | | | | | |} ==Boxing== Botswana entered one boxer into the Olympic tournament for the first time since London 2012. Keamogetse Kenosi scored an outright semifinal victory to secure a spot in the women's flyweight division at the 2020 African Qualification Tournament in Diamniadio, Senegal. {| class="wikitable" style="font-size:90%" |- !rowspan="2"|Athlete !rowspan="2"|Event !Round of 32 !Round of 16 !Quarterfinals !Semifinals !colspan=2|Final |-style="font- size:95%" !Opposition Result !Opposition Result !Opposition Result !Opposition Result !Opposition Result !Rank |-align=center |align=left|Keamogetse Kenosi |align=left|Women's featherweight | | | | | | |} ==References== == External links == Category:Nations at the 2020 Summer Olympics 2020 Category:2020 in Botswana sport
title: Botswana at the 2020 Summer Olympics
